definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: A city Laonongganzhao donkey, donkey Chuanghong Deng, fined 10 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 一老农赶著毛驴进城，驴闯红灯，罚10元。

sentences.english: If you insist, then just come here to me.
Here are nice little donkey sayings you can add to your gift.
sentences.chinese: 这里有可爱的小毛驴的说法，您可以添加到您的礼物。

sentences.english: The burro balked at climbing the path.
sentences.chinese: 小毛驴逡巡着不肯爬上小路。

sentences.english: See, that's why I called it a burro.
sentences.chinese: 懂了吧？这就是我称呼它毛驴的原因。

sentences.english: But you can ride our donkey.
sentences.chinese: 但你可以骑着我们的小毛驴去。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Equine Winter, Here are 35 wintery scenes of horses, donkeys and mules.
sentences.chinese: 这儿是马，毛驴和骡子的35个冬天的场景。

sentences.english: It was drawn by an old bay horse and a little grey-and-white burro.
sentences.chinese: 拉着它的是匹栗色的马和一头灰白的小毛驴。

sentences.english: 'I am looking for my donkey, ' answered Nasreddin.
sentences.chinese: “我正在找我的毛驴呢，”纳斯瑞丁回答。

sentences.english: But when a donkey came in, everyone began to laugh at the lute-player.
sentences.chinese: 当小毛驴走进王宫时，每个人看见他就开始笑起来。

sentences.english: The donkey bucked when it saw the snake.
sentences.chinese: 毛驴看见蛇时，猛然弓背跃起。

sentences.english: As Balaam was traveling by donkey to obey Balak's commands.
sentences.chinese: 巴兰骑着毛驴去执行巴勒命令。

sentences.english: The Act protects all unbranded horses and burros on public lands from capture.
sentences.chinese: 这个法令保护公共土地的所有野生马与毛驴免遭捕获。

sentences.english: Farmer Gimbel pulled and the policeman pushed, but the donkey didn't move.
sentences.chinese: 农夫吉伯尔拉，警察推，可毛驴一点也不动。

sentences.english: "You must move your donkey, "the policeman said.
sentences.chinese: “你必须把你的毛驴牵走，”警察说。

definition: to pull a carriage (of draft animal)
animals used for their physical strength (mules, oxen etc)/beast of burden
